column2: your wax has passed its high heat, which you will recognize when it no longer smokes
you will find it so, by scraping a little harder than the other where there is none
when they are still of such a heat as you have noticed before putting your finger in the hole, cast.
when scraping it with the fingernail, it is a sign that the crocum is good, very fine & well prepared
water so hot, that, at the beginning, you cannot hold your finger in it
until you can you can hold the tip of your finger in the cast without burning yourself
until you can hold your finger without harm in the hole of the gate
to the tongue you find the water moderately salty
they cry & crackle once brought near the ear
soft when handling it between the fingers
so that without burning yourself, you can hold your finger in it without burning yourself
so hot that you can bear putting your finger in it
one smells it & brings it close to the nose
of such heat that you cannot hold your finger there without feeling strong heat
of such heat that you can hold your finger there without harm in the hole
of such a heat that you can handle it without harm, or that you can keep your finger in the gate without burning yourself
is not felt between your fingers
You will know its goodness by rubbing it with your finger, which will render it very black immediately
This wax is very soft & amiable & pliant as copper, and it is so strong because of the sulfur, which renders it meltable much before the other, thus that you can prove it on a hot slate
I could hold my finger to it without burning myself
